      • selectQuery

        public <S extends CommonState> java.util.List<S> selectQuery(java.lang.Class c,
                                                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> select,
                                                             java.util.List<WhereClause> where)
        General select Query to retrieve all information for passed entity, can be used to return specified data from any table. It looks to the class for datatype information and matches each table field returned to the EntityState object by name. If specific select statements are made they only the corresponding object members will return with data. If the select parameter is null, all memebers will be returned. Table to query is determined by passing in the corresponding model class. (ex. MyObjectModel.class) Where clauses are passed as an List of Where objects which contain the key (or name), the value to check against, and the type of Conditional (applied between clauses if there is more then one, AND is the default). Example sql statement that would be generated for the following class: User.class and where: {[firstName, Larry], [lastName, Smith, AND]} would be: SELECT * FROM User where firstName = 'Larry' AND lastName = 'Smith';
        Specified by:
        selectQuery in interface CorePersistenceImpl
        Type Parameters:
        S - Type extending CommonState to query and return
        Parameters:
        c - Class of entity to select from
        where - where clauses
        Returns:
        data queried
